result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Andrew T Jakubowski was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
but IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 3 days granted.

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. FINE PAID IN FULL.

BAIL APPLIED TO ALL COSTS.
Transcript fee will be forwarded to the DA's office.
Blood fees will be forwarded to the Waukesha Sheriff's dept.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle  TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP
6/23/17 Request from DOC to covert remaining confinement time to extended supervision.
Associated with Charge #1
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew T Jakubowski in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addressed possible conflict of interest.  State and defense have no objection to the Court continuing with this case.  Court proceeds with plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read-in.  Count 5 is dismissed by operation of law.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 3 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
*No contact with victims listed in the Complaint;
*Provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (apply cash bail - to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department)

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $8.00 (apply cash bail )

RESTITUTION:  $1,000.00 (already paid)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (apply cash bail)

FINE:  $2,327.00 (apply cash bail - refund balance, if any, to poster);

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
